text.p: Here are the highlights of stories in the Danish press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-- Consumer ombudsman Hagen Joergensen is demanding that banks automatically give each customer the best interest rate available and end the practice of negotiating rates individually.
--Competition authorities say that leading dairies MD Foods and Klover Maelk must allow supermarket chains the opportunity to have products packaged under their own labels.
-- The head of the Danish Economic Council, the Wise Men, says that Danish supporters of EMU consistently ignore the possibility that the union could be economicly unstable.
--Institutional investor Kommunernes Pensionsforsikring is to increase its share portfolio this year at the expense of its bond holdings.
--Junckers Industries is offering 900 employees a 2,000 crown bonus every third month if they take no sick leave during the period.
--The food ministry plans to make public the names of food producers whose hygiene is insufficient, as it did recently with restaurants.
--Denmark's central bank has openly criticised the Wise Men for recommending that Denmark wait to join EMU until the union is proved to be economically stable.
--The good state of the Danish economy will bring a wave of business investment. Falls in interest rates have brought about a marked consolidation and industry will now use its money for development.
